titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation, signifying his Majesties pleasure, that all men being in office of government at the decease of the late King, his Majesties most dear and most entirely beloved brother, shall so continue, till his Majesties further direction.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill deceas'd: and by Henry Hills, and Thomas Newcomb, printers to the Kings most Excellent Majesty,
Printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to his most sacred Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Royal coat of arms at head of text; initial letter.
Dated at end: Given at the court at Whitehall the sixth day of February, in the the first year of His Majesty's reign of England, Scotland, France and Ireland.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
